requirements.summary: Adjust LilyPage container/padding so the title, description, image block, and engagement/action buttons align flush-left with no extra left indentation, while preserving avatar/metadata layout and responsiveness.
acceptanceCriteria: On the LilyPage, the left edges of the title, description, image, and engagement/action row align consistently (no additional left indentation relative to each other).
The change removes the visible left gap the user referenced without breaking the avatar/metadata display.
Layout remains responsive (mobile and desktop) and does not introduce horizontal overflow or clipped content.
No changes to backend behavior, data fetching, or mutations are required for this UI-only alignment update.

file_operations.description: Remove/replace the extra horizontal padding/indentation on the lily content wrapper (currently adding a larger left inset than surrounding sections) so the title, description, image block, and engagement/action row share the same flush-left start. Keep the avatar + metadata row intact, and ensure mobile/desktop responsive padding remains consistent with the rest of the page (e.g., matching the px-4 / lg:px-0 pattern used below).
